name: Dumbbell Curtsy Lunge
instructions: Stand with your feet hip-width apart holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
Take your right leg and step it back and across your left leg, bending both knees as if performing a curtsy.
Lower your hips until your left thigh is parallel to the floor, keeping your torso upright.
Push through your left heel to return to the starting position.
Repeat on the other side.

name: Ring Row
instructions: Adjust the rings to an appropriate height. Grab the rings with a neutral grip and lean back, keeping your body straight from head to heels.
Your arms should be fully extended. This is your starting position.
Pull your chest up toward the rings by bending your elbows and retracting your shoulder blades.
Keep your body straight throughout the movement.
Pause at the top, then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: Seal Row
instructions: Set up a bench on elevated platforms or boxes so you can lie face down with arms hanging straight down.
Grab a barbell or dumbbells with an overhand grip, arms fully extended toward the floor.
Pull the weight up toward your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: Switch Jump
instructions: Start in a lunge position with one foot forward and one foot back, both knees bent at 90 degrees.
Explosively jump up, switching your legs in mid-air.
Land softly in a lunge position with the opposite leg forward.
Immediately jump again to switch legs.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: Copenhagen Hold
instructions: Position yourself sideways next to a bench or elevated surface.
Place your top leg on the bench with your knee or foot, depending on difficulty level desired.
Keep your bottom leg extended and hovering above the ground.
Support your upper body with your forearm on the ground, maintaining a straight line from head to heels.
Hold this position, engaging your adductors and core.
Maintain the hold for the prescribed duration, then switch sides.

name: Cable Step Down
instructions: Stand on an elevated platform or box with one foot near the edge.
Hold a cable handle in one or both hands for added resistance.
Slowly lower your free leg toward the ground by bending the knee of the leg on the platform.
Control the descent, keeping your weight on the heel of your elevated foot.
Push through your heel to return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions, then switch legs.
